title: Drawing, "Design for Dedication Page to Charles III of Naples", ca. 1762
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and wash, black chalk on white laid paper
markings: Stamped, verso: Cooper Union Museum New York.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower left: Gio. Batta Tiepolo inv. e del.; lower right: Giovanni Volpato incis. Venezia; on mount, in pen and brown ink, lower left:  de Juan Bacctista 'Tiepolo's;  lower right: lo...Volpato.
description: At center, a winged figure of Glory (at left) alights and places the sculpted bust of King Charles III on a pedestal decorated with swags and a cartouche. In front of  the pedestal, a cherub (seen from the back) sits amid symbols of the arts and war.  Another cherub hovers in mid-air to the right of the pedestal; a group of figures stand in left middle-background beneath a partial view of  colonnaded temple and figure, upper left corner.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Dedication Page to Charles III of Naples", ca. 1762.
ca. 1762. Pen and brown ink, brush and wash, black chalk on white laid paper. Bequest of Erskine Hewitt. 1938-57-219-a.
